challengeName: Topcoder - Discourse Email Notifications Customization For User Profile Link
detailedRequirements:
In Topcoder Connect v2, we are using Discourse as underlying implemebation for messaging.  Whenever a private message is posted or replied to, Discourse automatically sends out an email notification to the users involved in that discussion. This email notification contains a link to user profile of Discourse, but what we want to do is to include a link to topcoder profile instead.

the original part in html version of email is like 

<a href="http://talk.topcoder.com/users/cp-superstar" target="_blank" style="text-decoration: none; font-weight: bold; color: #006699;; font-size:13px;font-family:'lucida grande',tahoma,verdana,arial,sans-serif;color:#3b5998;text-decoration:none;font-weight:bold">cp-superstar</a>


So we'd like this part be customizable, like using topcoder profile link - https://www.topcoder.com/members/FireIce

In Discourse, under Settings -> Customize -> Email Templates, you can change all email templates that used to create those emails. 

And it kind of worked, the problem is that the email sent out from discourse has 2 versions, a html and a text version. This change in the template updated the text version of the email, but email clients like gmail seem to always display the html version of the email by default.

The only option that I think we have is to make a change to the Discourse code. but this will be the last consideration.

So, for this challenge we'd like to figure out the following questions with your reach.

1- Is it possible to configure Discourse to send the text version of the emails only?
2- Is it possible to change the html version of the message without making code changes?
3- Is it possible to add something to the message to force email clients to display the text version of the message instead of the html version of the message?
4- If code changes are really the only option, please provide the changes that need to be made to update the message template, and the steps to deploy it to the docker version of Discourse. 
5- Any other options?
finalSubmissionGuidelines: - Clear Explanation and Code changes for answering each question
